name: 裴重恩
objective: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of deep learning techniques and their applications in space technology. It covers the fundamentals of neural networks, advanced deep learning architectures, and practical applications in space data analysis and autonomous systems. Students will gain hands-on experience with popular deep learning frameworks and real-world space technology datasets.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Space Technology
Week 2: AI Applications in Space Technology
Week 3: Space Image Processing I
Week 4: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) I
Week 5: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) Focused on Tiny Objects in Earth Observation
Week 6: Space Image Processing II (with CNNs)
Week 7: Midterm Exam
Week 8: Advanced CNN Techniques (Edge Computing on Satellite Payload)
Week 9: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) I
Week 10: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) II
Week 11: Autoencoders and Anomaly Detection
Week 12: Advanced Space Applications I
Week 13: Advanced Space Applications II
Week 14: Deep Reinforcement Learning
Week 15: Remote Sensing Data Encryption
Week 16: Ethical Implications of AI in Space Exploration
Week 17: Final Report and Presentation I
Week 18: Final Report and Presentation II
scorePolicy:
1. Quizzes (10%)
•	Frequency: Weekly quizzes starting from Week 2.
•	Purpose: To assess the understanding of the weekly topics and readings.
•	Format: Multiple choice, short answer questions, and coding snippets.
2. Assignments (30%)
•	Frequency: Bi-weekly assignments starting from Week 1.
•	Purpose: To provide hands-on experience with the concepts taught in class.
•	Format: Coding assignments, data analysis tasks, and short projects.
•	Submission: Via the course's online platform.
3. Midterm Exam (20%)
•	Week: 7
•	Purpose: To evaluate the comprehensive understanding of the topics covered in the first half of the course.
•	Format: Combination of multiple-choice questions, short answers, and practical coding problems.
4. Project (30%)
•	Frequency: Throughout the course with final submission in Week 18.
•	Purpose: To apply the concepts learned in a comprehensive project that integrates deep learning and space technology.
•	Format: Project proposal, progress reports, final report, and presentation.
•	Components:
             Project Proposal: 5%
             Progress Reports: 5%
             Final Report: 15%
             Presentation: 5%
5. Participation (10%)
•	Frequency: Ongoing throughout the course.
•	Purpose: To encourage active participation in class discussions, forums, and group activities.
•	Format: Attendance, contributions to discussions, peer reviews, and teamwork.
materials:
"Satellite Technology: Principles and Applications" by Anil K. Maini and Varsha Agrawal
"Neural Networks and Deep Learning: A Textbook" by Charu C. Aggarwal
